Anchorites of the proteans, hegessiks live solitary lives roaming the dangerous wilds of the [Maelstrom](/Planes.aspx?ID=19). There, they contemplate cosmic truths and dispense wisdom as itinerant mystics. Hegessiks proudly bear their ridges of golden feathers and gleaming gemstones, but it is within their third eye that their wisdom resides. Hegessiks normally have little interaction with the fluctuations of protean society and are more likely to be found liaising with non-protean monitors and followers of those deities—like [Nethys](/Deities.aspx?ID=12) and [Besmara](/Deities.aspx?ID=32)— who share the Maelstrom with proteans. **[Recall Knowledge - Monitor](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13)): DC 34 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 32 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 29 [Hegessik](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1019) **Source** [Pathfinder #162: Ruins of the Radiant Siege](/Sources.aspx?ID=54) pg. 80 **Perception** +29; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12), entropy sense (imprecise) 60 feet **Languages** [Abyssal](/Languages.aspx?ID=12), [Celestial](/Languages.aspx?ID=16), [Protean](/Languages.aspx?ID=33); [telepathy](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=37) 100 feet, [_tongues_](/Spells.aspx?ID=340) **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +25, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +27, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) +29, [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=6) +29, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +27, [Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13) +29, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +27, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=16) +27 **Str** +8 **Dex** +6 **Con** +7 **Int** +4 **Wis** +6 **Cha** +6 **Entropy Sense** ([divination](/Traits.aspx?ID=47), [divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [prediction](/Traits.aspx?ID=132)) A hegessik can anticipate the most likely location of a creature through their supernatural insight into the forces of chaotic probabilities and chance. This grants the hegessik the ability to sense creatures within the listed range. The hegessik's entropy sense doesn't detect creatures under the effects of [_nondetection_](/Spells.aspx?ID=209) or that are otherwise shielded from [divinations](/Traits.aspx?ID=47) and [predictions](/Traits.aspx?ID=132). --- **AC** 37 **Fort** +26 **Ref** +23 **Will** +29 +1 status to all saves vs. [divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48) magic **HP** 250 ([fast healing](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=15) 10) **Resistances** precision 10, protean anatomy 20 **Weaknesses** lawful 15 **Maddening Whispers** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=206), [divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [enchantment](/Traits.aspx?ID=61), [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106)) 30 feet. A susurrus of distracting whispers and dilations in reality surround a hegessik. When a non-[protean](/Traits.aspx?ID=231) ends its turn in the aura, it must attempt a DC 33 Will save. If it fails, it becomes confused for 1 round.
**Protean Anatomy** ([divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [transmutation](/Traits.aspx?ID=157)) A hegessik's vital organs shift and change shape and position constantly. Immediately after the hegessik takes acid, electricity, or sonic damage, it gains the listed amount of resistance to that damage type. This lasts for 1 hour or until the next time the protean takes damage of one of the other types (in which case its resistance changes to match that type), whichever comes first.
 The hegessik is immune to [polymorph](/Traits.aspx?ID=127) effects unless it is a willing target. If [blinded](/Conditions.aspx?ID=1) or [deafened](/Conditions.aspx?ID=8), the hegessik automatically recovers at the end of its next turn as new sensory organs grow to replace the compromised ones. --- **Speed** 30 feet, fly 30 feet, swim 30 feet; [_freedom of movement_](/Spells.aspx?ID=128) **Melee** jaws +30 ([Chaotic](/Traits.aspx?ID=25), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 3d8+14 piercing plus 1d6 chaotic and warpwave strike **Melee** claw +30 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Chaotic](/Traits.aspx?ID=25), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 2d8+14 slashing plus 1d6 chaotic **Melee** tail +30 ([Chaotic](/Traits.aspx?ID=25), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 15 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 2d8+14 bludgeoning plus 1d6 chaotic and [Grab](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=18) **Divine Innate Spells** DC 38 - **2nd** [Detect Alignment](/Spells.aspx?ID=65) (at will; lawful only) - **4th** [Dimension Door](/Spells.aspx?ID=69) (at will) - **5th** [Dimension Door](/Spells.aspx?ID=69) - **6th** [Baleful Polymorph](/Spells.aspx?ID=17), [Slow](/Spells.aspx?ID=289) (at will), [Teleport](/Spells.aspx?ID=338) (at will; self only) - **7th** [Dispel Magic](/Spells.aspx?ID=78) (at will), [Plane Shift](/Spells.aspx?ID=222) - **8th** [Confusion](/Spells.aspx?ID=48), [Divine Aura](/Spells.aspx?ID=81) (chaotic only), [Divine Wrath](/Spells.aspx?ID=86) (chaotic only) - **Constant (4th)** [Freedom of Movement](/Spells.aspx?ID=128) - **Constant (5th)** [Tongues](/Spells.aspx?ID=340) **[Change Shape](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=8)** ([Concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32), [Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Polymorph](/Traits.aspx?ID=127), [Transmutation](/Traits.aspx?ID=157)) The hegessik takes the appearance of any Large or smaller creature. This doesn't change its Speed or its attack and damage bonuses with its Strikes, but might change the damage type its Strikes deal. **[Constrict](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=10)** 2d8+14 bludgeoning, DC 36 **Leaching Glare** ([Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Enchantment](/Traits.aspx?ID=61)) The hegessik briefly opens its third eye. Non-protean creatures in a 30-foot cone must succeed at a DC 38 Will save or become [stupefied 2](/Conditions.aspx?ID=37) for 1 round (stupefied 3 on a critical failure). **Telekinetic Reach** ([Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Evocation](/Traits.aspx?ID=65), [Force](/Traits.aspx?ID=75)) The hegessik manifests psychic versions of its natural attacks and makes a Strike with each of its jaws, claw, and tail, in any order. These Strikes have a reach of 60 feet. These attacks count toward the hegessik's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after it makes all the attacks. **Warpwave Strike** ([Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Transmutation](/Traits.aspx?ID=157)) Any creature struck and damaged by a hegessik's jaws Strike must succeed at a DC 36 Fortitude save or be subject to a warpwave (see Warpwave below).
Choruses of One Heggesiks are nominally included in the protean caste system, but they almost never join the protean choruses formed around shared philosophies. The hegessiks consider themselves to be outside such cliques, seeking their own enlightenment in the archetypal wildernesses of the [Maelstrom](/Planes.aspx?ID=19).
